oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Model 1840 dragoon saber with scabbard
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The saber has its original grips, which are in fairly good condition, with no markings on the ricasso. It was painted gold at one time, and possibly belonged to Cpl. Allen D. Armstrong, Co. G, 32nd Tenn. Inf., CSA, of Belfast, Marshall County, Tenn. Armstrong was captured at Ft. Donelson on February 16, 1862, and sent to Camp Morton, Ind. He was paroled, and transferred to Co. C, 17th Tenn. Inf. Regt. At the order of Gen. Braxton Bragg on June 17, 1863.
